snippet: The league’s entry requirements, N.C.A.A. rules on amateurism and football’s demanding nature mean players must give at least three years to their universities while risking career-ending injuries....
abstract: Marc Tracy On College Football column discusses how decision by some football players to stay in college through their senior year effects their standing in NFL draft; maintains players who stay longer in college risk injury, which can lower their standing in draft, but could also gain experience and maturity.
lead_paragraph: The league’s entry requirements, N.C.A.A. rules on amateurism and football’s demanding nature mean players must give at least three years to their universities while risking career-ending injuries.

headline.print_headline: Top Prospects Walk a Perilous Tightrope for N.F.L. Eligibility
headline.main: Eligibility Rules Leave Top N.F.L. Prospects Walking a Perilous Tightrope
